title: Conor McGregor responds to Tyson Fury after Gypsy King confirms MMA plans
text:

Conor McGregor has thrown his support behind Tyson Fury after the heavyweight boxer announced plans to make his MMA debut .

The Gypsy King revealed on Sunday that he was hopeful of competing in the UFC this year.

And speaking at the NFL clash at Wembley between the Los Angeles Rams and Cincinnati Bengals, Fury added that McGregor had proposed the idea of them being training partners.

"He [McGregor] just said 'any time you're ready, let's go," Fury said. "Come over to Dublin and we'll start training'. I can't wait. I'm going to take him up on the offer."

(Image: SIPA USA/PA Images)

And it seems McGregor is all for it, tweeting in response: "Up the Fury’s! Let’s go."

Fury is already on a hiatus from boxing ahead of his first competitive WWE bout at the Crown Jewel event in Saudi Arabia on Thursday.

But it seems Fury is not content with leaving it there.

He said: "You might see Tyson Fury have his MMA debut this year. It's different but, like I say, Tyson Fury [is] taking over.

(Image: REUTERS)

"Yeah, I've been speaking to Conor [McGregor] about it and he's willing to train me and it's going to be good.

"I come from a long line of bare knuckle boxing champions and getting hurt, getting bloodied...

"You saw in my last fight that there was blood everywhere, it's nothing new to me. It's all a part of my heritage. I would love to get in there and smash someone up."

McGregor has only just announced his plans to return to the sport in January next year, having last fought back in October.

The Irishman is due to fight on January 17th in Las Vegas against an as yet unnamed opponent.

Fury teased: "We might be on a double header - The Gypsy King and Conor McGregor . Watch this space."
description: The lineal heavyweight champion is looking to step into the Octagon after his appearance on WWE Crown Jewel
